actions.text: Referred to House Committee on Judiciary.

official_title: A bill to provide for the constitutional conduct of the Federal Government as it relates to the Economic Opportunity Act of 1964, as amended.

summary.text: Sets forth the findings of the Congress in regard to the programs and benefits of the Economics Opportunity Act of 1964. Requires all persons and officers of the Federal Government to immediately void and rescind all actions or orders which will stop or impede the orderly finding or operation of programs under such Act. Provides that any future impedance or major alteration of said programs shall occur at only the direction of the Congress, except: (1) in case of national emergency; (2) in cases where persons or programs have made unauthorized uses of the Act; or (3) in the event appropriated funds are depleted by uses authorized in the Act before the end of fiscal 1972.

titles.title: A bill to provide for the constitutional conduct of the Federal Government as it relates to the Economic Opportunity Act of 1964, as amended.
